recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place black-eyed peas into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 8 hours to overnight. Drain and rinse."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat; cook and stir ham until browned, about 5 minutes. Add onion, green bell pepper, and garlic; saute until onion is tender, about 10 minutes. Add black-eyed peas, water, bay leaves, paprika, salt, and black pepper; cover pot with a lid and simmer until peas are tender, 40 to 50 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove bay leaves from black-eyed peas mixture and stir in rice. Simmer until all the liquid is evaporated, 5 to 10 more minutes."}]

recipe_card: Roasted Pork Tenderloin 117 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pounds pork tenderloin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon ground sage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"garlic salt to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (32 ounce) jar sauerkraut, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  apple"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup brown sugar"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Rub tenderloin with sage and garlic salt. Place tenderloin in a baking pan or casserole. Cover meat with half of the sauerkraut. Place the apple and onion, cut side down, on top of the sauerkraut. Cover with remaining sauerkraut. Sprinkle with brown sugar."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover and bake in preheated oven for 2 to 3 hours, until the internal temperature has reached 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)."}]

recipe_card: Slow Cooker Southern Lima Beans and Ham 93 Ratings
recipe_name: Slow Cooker Southern Lima Beans and Ham
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound dried baby lima beans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 quarts water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  onions, coarsely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  meaty ham bone"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup leftover ham meat from bone, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups water, or as needed to cover"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon Cajun seasoning"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon garlic salt, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch cayenne pepper"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Soak lima beans in 2 quarts of water in a large bowl for 8 hours or overnight. The next day, drain the lima beans and place into a slow cooker with onions, ham bone, and ham. Pour in 3 cups of water or as needed to cover. Place lid on the cooker, set to High, and cook for 3 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in Cajun seasoning, black pepper, garlic salt, and cayenne pepper; set cooker to Low and cook until the beans and meat are very tender, about 4 more hours."}]

recipe_card: Slow Cooker Ham and Beans 156 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound dried great Northern beans, soaked overnight"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ pound cooked ham, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon onion powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon dried parsley"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon garlic salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8 cups water, or as needed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine beans, ham, brown sugar, onion powder, parsley, garlic salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a slow cooker. Pour enough water into the slow cooker to cover the mixture by about 2 inches. Cover and cook on Low, stirring occasionally, for 12 hours."}]

recipe_card: Wonton Soup 413 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ pound boneless pork loin, coarsely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ounces peeled shrimp, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon light soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon finely chopped green onions"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon chopped fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"24  (3.5 inch square) wonton wrappers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups chicken stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons finely chopped green onions"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Make the wontons: Mix pork, shrimp, rice wine, soy sauce, brown sugar, green onions, and ginger together in a large bowl until well combined. Let stand for 25 to 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon about 1 teaspoon filling onto the center of a wonton wrapper. Moisten all four wrapper edges with water and fold over filling to make a triangle; press the edges firmly to seal. Bring left and right corners together above filling; overlap the tips of these corners, moisten with water, and press together to seal. Repeat until all wrappers have been filled and sealed."},{"recipe_directions":"Make the soup: Bring chicken stock to a rolling boil in a pot. Gently drop in wontons and cook for 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Ladle into bowls and garnish with green onions."}]
